mona ahuja wrote:

> I have two questions.
> 
> the only test I can think of here is making sure that checkboxes are not 
> checked when the window opens . i mean not familiar with Junit Testing 
> so I really dont know ifthere could be any more cases and
> how do i test it. I cant create an instance of CheckListPrototype since 
> it has a private constructor.

None of these are questions. :)

You want to verify that the screen looks right when you start. Extract 
the code that lays out the screen, then test it separately using a tool 
like Jemmy. Dave Astels' book A Practical Guide to Test-Driven 
Development uses a Swing-based application as its running example, and 
so would be valuable to you.

As for creating a instance of CheckListPrototype, what if you just made 
the constructor public?
